cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 355 mi SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-north-eastward, aiming at southeastern Louisiana then sweeping across the Mississippi coast and the interior Southeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Buras/Grand Isle – just south of New Orleans)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the Alabama–Florida border
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely at port (surge 3–5 ft confined to Lake Pontchartrain/coastal zones, port is well upriver)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 kt) with gusts possibly reaching 50-55 kt Wednesday afternoon and evening; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the core tracks just east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor river surge on the lower Mississippi possible but significant coastal surge will remain south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with pockets up to 6 inches, producing short-duration flash‐flooding in low areas and along terminal access roads
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, scattered power outages, debris on access roads, temporary closure of Mississippi River navigation during peak winds
